lines.text: That was two wishes. Take your time with the third.
[menacingly]
Or you will wish you had never been born.

[about Jafar]
Don't worry, Abu. He's a genie, and genies can't kill anyone.
[Jafar's hands turn into dragons and spray fire all over Genie and Abu]

[wheezing]
But you'd be surprised what you can live through.
If it weren't for *me*, you'd still be in a cage at the bazaar squawking, "Polly want a cracker!"
The street rat is living in the palace now? Aah! That does it! All reports are in! Life is now officially unfair!
I've got sand in places I didn't even know I had!

[heard from inside his lamp]
Spare me your prattling, Iago. Are we out yet?

[mimcking Jafar]
'Are we out yet? Are we out yet?' Yes, we're out!

[hesitating on freeing Jafar]
Wait. How do I know that these things won't disappear once I set you free?
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text:
[losing it]
The more pressing question is, how will you stay alive if you don't?

[sees a giant ruby]
Ooh - hoo, I always wanted one of those.
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: [runs forward and hugs it]
Nice! More, MORE!
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text:
[relaxing on a large cushion]
Oh, yeah. Being one of the good guys has his advantages. Ahh, advisor to Aladdin, the new grand vizier. And when Aladdin becomes Sultan, that will make me the grand vizier! Only I'm not gonna blow it like that idiot Jafar!
[he eats a cluster of grapes, then tosses the stem away]

[talking with his mouth full]
I'll never have to stand in his shadow again.
[the lights go out, a spotlight switches on over Iago and Jafar appears out of the darkness]

[startled and spits grapes out]
Awk!
[Jafar steps forwards]
Jafar!
[chuckles nervously]
Buddy?

[running up to Jasmine with Abu to catch Sultan and Aladdin]
Make room for the picnic boys!
They already left, Genie.
Without us?
Without us?
No problem, I'll catch up in a flash.
Wait! Without me, too. Aladdin needs some time alone with Father to patch things up.

[to Abu]
You know what this means, monkey boy? More food for us!

Iago, you betrayed me and allied yourself with my enemies! Then you turned on them as soon at it was in your best interests. That's what I love about you. You're so perfectly predictable. A villain through and through!

[Thinking he destroyed Jafar]
Hahahaha! Who's laughing now?
Hahahahaa!
[Reappears]
Why, I believe it's me.
Argh!

[arriving from his trip around the world]
He's big, he's blue! And he's BACK!

[as he and Jasmine hug the Genie]
Genie!
You came back!

[turning red, yelling and wincing]
Ooh! Ah! Oh, watch the sunburrrn!
[stops wincing, then turns blue again]
Aha! Kidding. Did you miss me? Be honest.
[handing his luggage to Abu]
Take care of these, my good mammal.
[Abu takes the luggage but falls down from Aladdin's shoulder]
Careful they're heavy. Hang on, I've got souveniers for everybody!
[crying]
Come on, princess! Don't waist your tears on him.
You! Get out of here!
Hey, don't take it out on me. He's the creep. I never should have saved his life.
Saved his life?
Yeah. He owed me one. That's why he stood up for me.
But he didn't have to lie to me.
You are so right.
[Genie saves Aladdin from being beheaded]
Thanks for saving me.
bibbidi-bobbidi-BOO! Ho-ho, and everybody's safe and sound.
I got it! I could wish for the famed treasure chest of King Malakhan!
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: [Jafar makes the chest appear with Abis Mal in it, then makes it disappear]
Oh, I am dreadfully sorry. I thought that was your wish. Are you quite all right?

[agitated]
No, I am not quite all right.
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: Wonderful! Good to see all is well.
[Last lines]
Does this mean I don't get my third wish?
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text:
[singing]
Men cower at the power in my pinky / My thumb is number one on every list! But if you're not convinced that I'm invincible / put me to the test / I'd love to lay this rivalry to rest!

[talking about the hula skirt girl]
Oooh, she dances!

[to Iago]
How could you double cross Aladdin after all he's done for you?
[chatters angrily]
Hey! Do I insult your mother?
[Abu stops and gives Iago a dirty look]

[bellowing at first, then softening down]
You will now release me! So that I may have my revenge.

[pulling himself loose from the sand, then shaking himself off]
Yeah, yeah, when I'm good and ready.
Do as I say, you worthless pipsqueak!
You know something? You're nothing without me.
What?
Who comes up with all the good ideas? Me! Who does all the work? Me!

[while Jafar slashes the Sultan's turban]
Hey, that was a nice hat. I could've worn that hat.
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: We need this for our plan.
Couldn't we use another hat for the plan?
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: Oh, no. The Sultan's turban and this dagger are exactly what we need to seal Aladdin's doom.

[impersonating Jiminy Cricket from "Pinocchio"]
Just let your conscience be your guide.
Conscience? Never had one! Never.

[to Aladdin]
You shall never have my lamp, and there is no one to save you this time!

[swooping down, shouting]
Hey, Jafar! Shut up!

[to Abis Mal]
Let's not be too hasty, my simple minded friend. It's not enough that we simply destroy Aladdin. After all, there are things so much worse than death!
[laughs menacingly]
[smiles evilly]
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: You saw the whole world already?

[sings]
It's A Small World after all.
[turns back to normal and speaks]
But Agrahbah has something that no other place in the world has.
[Turns into a rocket and shouts]
You guys!
And Iago, talk about a rat with wings!
Genie?
Whoo! That bird was mean!
[Turns his head into Iago]
"Sultan want a cracker? Sultan want a cracker?"
[His head returns to normal]
Remember that?
I can still taste them - the traitor!
Yes, sir! You don't see this guy hanging out with any evil parrots.
Uh, it's funny, you should mention Iago.

[to himself]
That stinking Aladdin! First chance I get, I'll slice him in half!
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text:
[to other thieves]
That stinking Abis Mal! First chance we get, let's slice him in half!
Sultan, I have to tell you something about Iago.
[tickles Rajah's nose with one of his feathers]
[sneezes Iago out in front of Sultan]

[gulps nervously]
He's here.
[Aladdin, Abu, and Iago bump into Abis Mal and company]
You - look familiar.
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text:
[chorusing]
It's Aladdin!
What, it is? I - I knew that! Hurt him a lot! Hurt him, and his monkey, and his bird, too!
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text:
[smearing dirt all over himself]
I'll just get Aladdin on my side with a little sympathy act. And I'll be back in the palace again quicker than you can say "Easy Street."
[Aladdin turns corner to find Iago panting for breath]
Aladdin - kid finally got free - of Jafar.
[coughs]
Iago! What are you doing here?
Where are you? Getting dark. Hold me.
[Aladdin fiercely grabs at him]

[screams]
Hey, I meant gentle-like!
Reality check. Jafar is large and in charge!

[singing]
Pack your shield, pack your sword, you won't ever get bored / though get beaten or gored you might / Come on down stop on by / hop a carpet and fly to another Arabian Night.

[laughs sinisterly]
Good help is so hard to find these days, isn't it, Aladdin?
The street rat? Still alive? No!
[after Iago has knocked the lamp into the molten magma]
My lamp!
[yells when he notices that he's losing his powers]
No!
I can't just stay in the palace! There's too much to do, too much to see.
[after Princess Jasmine has said that she is also going to see the world]

[flying around]
Crazy talk! Why do I keep getting hooked up with these warped people?
[the camera pans out from the palace]

[sweetly]
Shouldn't somebody ask what the brave parrot wants to do?
Giddy up, slowpoke, what's keeping you?
Nothing. Well, something, but I'll tell you later.
[Aladdin is accused for the murder of the Sultan]
And then you went over the waterfall, eh? Ha! How did you survive?

[hanging his head in shame]
I I don't know.

[crosses his arms in disbelief]
How very convenient.
It's the truth! Why won't you believe me?

[off camera]
Because we know you're lying.
What?
I found this in your room!
[holds out the Sultan's tattered turban]
My father's turban slashed.
You can't think!
I thought you loved me, but now I see that all you wanted to do was rule Agrabah!
I never wanted!
He shall die at dawn - for the murder of my father!
[Jasmine runs off, stops at the door and then shuts it]
Jasmine, please!
[restrains Aladdin]
You're in my hands now, street rat!
[Genie and the Carpet are playing pool]
Your shot.
[pause]
Pool's a man's game; so being a rug, you'll be at a disadvantage.
[Carpet clears the table with break shot]
Eh, pool's a dumb game anyway.

[after he demands Abis Mal to take him and the lamp to Agrabah, which makes Abis Mal speak nervous gibberish]
I suppose I am a bit too much for his limited mind.

[he and Abis Mal appear at the sunken treasure ship of Coeur du Mer]
Poor, sweet baby. Aren't we enjoying our wish?

[muffled, as an octupus wraps one of its tentacles around Abis Mal]
No.
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: Perhaps you wish me to return you to the desert?

[muffled]
Yes.
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: Very well!

[opening a treasure chest]
Is this a haul or what, my surly band of desert skunks?
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: Grrr, how is it that you get the jeweled flower, Abis Mal?
Why, this is my bonus for being your beloved leader!
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: [as he points to his flower, then two sacks of jewels]
And this, and that, and that are my beloved leader bonus.
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: And what is our reward?
[the other thieves grumble in question]

[tossing a bag of coins to them]
Here you go. Good work, boys. Very successful raid.
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text:
[chanting]
Without you, the Amazon is just a trickle. Without you, the Sahara's not so hot.
So Genie, how does it feel to be free?
Seriously? I love it!
Who are you?
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: My friends call me Al, but you can call me Aladdin.
Gah - hurt him!
lines.character: Abis Mal, the Chief of the Thieves

lines.text: Give it up Jafar! We're obviously too much for you to handle!
You! You're a fool to challenge me! I am all powerful!
Some all powerful. You can't even get rid of a lowly street rat!
A problem I need to rectify right NOW!
Aladdin!
Rajah! You know better than to tear around the palace like that!

[opens up Rajah's mouth]
Help!
[Aladdin closes Rajah's mouth to hide Iago from Jasmine and Sultan]
Hey!
So, Aladdin why did you bring up that deceitful parrot?
